head.title: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Camden: Plant Passes Emissions Test

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Camden: Plant Passes Emissions Test

body.head.byline: By Steve Strunsky (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: Cement plant in Camden, NJ, owned by St Lawrence Cement Group, passes first annual emissions test since opening in June 2001 (S)

block.p: A cement-additive plant that local groups say pollutes their neighborhood passed its first annual emissions test since opening in June, the state said yesterday. The plant passed what is known as a stack test, which was administered in October and certified last week, said Amy Collings, a spokeswoman for the Department of Environmental Protection. The department was the defendant in a lawsuit filed by black and Hispanic groups charging the department with ''environmental racism'' for allowing operation of the plant, owned by St. Lawrence Cement Group. A federal appeals panel dismissed the suit on Jan. 16. The groups have not yet decided whether to appeal.
